title: The state of balance of this game is determined by how healthy the jungle meta is.
body:
Face it the overall health of the game is determined by the jungle meta. Sure there will always be a few outliers like right now talon and pantheon for lanes but that usually doesn't last more than a patch or two. Where as jungle metas last like a season to almost a season because its more about items and difficulty of jungling.

Everyone loved the cinderhulk meta because despite sej being op as all get out you can just ban sej and then there's a myriad of junglers (25-30 options) who are viable within 1-2% of 50%. No one loved the lee sin meta because getting ganked at 3 minutes and then auto losing lane due to snowballing (Losing 2-4 waves) was boring, toxic and basically meant you got to do very little for 20-30 minutes.

The 2nd worst pre season was also created exclusively by this issue. Feral flare produced the most horrible, depressing, boring meta in league history. Literally the entire game did not matter. It was merely a contest to determine who could get more stacks. Once a Yi hit 70-100 stacks he just couldn't die. Same with udyr, shyv and tons more. The health of this game, the overall happiness of the player, and the enjoyably of the game is tied to the jungle.

Thats simply not true. Apart from being immortal during the midgame (chinderhulk meta!), most tanks have more escapes in their kit than Lee sin, Elise or khazix.

Gragas: low cooldown dash in any direction he wants, stong slow on his q and a aoe knockback on his ult
Seju: low cooldown dash on her q in any direction she wants, stong slow on her e and a aoe stun on her ult
Zac: medium slow on his q, extrem long range jump on his e in any direction he wants, multiple dashes in any direction he wants + knockbacks on his ult, revive passiv

Lee Sin: targeted dash to an enemy with his q, targeted jump to an ally on his w, single target knockback on his ult
Elise: short range jump to an enemy on her q (can't even jump over a wall), targeted dash to an enemy with her e on a long cd
Khazix: medium/long range jump on his e, short invis.

I'm not considering if they can use a specific skill as escape (Lee Sin goes in with his q --> his q is on cd and can't be used as escape). I think its pretty stupid to say that a role, which should get hit by as much abilities as possible, requires good position in fights.

Because being killed in under 1 second has no real counter play other than getting ahead early and getting lucky on enemy pathing in the first 5 minutes. Getting killed in 3-5 seconds means you need to be very far away from the team and out of position to die. If you die in 1 second "Out of position" is less than melee range from an ally where as 3-5 seconds is the difference between being killed under your first tower before a tower shot goes off and being killed beneath your inner as the jungler comes to punish the over dive.

They don't take less skill. Its just that they can kill you and therefore are more likely to elicit feelings of disgust, altering your view of the champion and causing you to label them unfairly.

Tank junglers require less skill but more luck, as they need their team to not be shitheads. Winning a game as Malphite on a team with bad players is nearly impossible regardless of how good you are. Winning a Malph game on a team with competent and responsive players is as easy as landing a couple of good ults. Assassin junglers may be more capable of carrying bad teammates, but due to low utility they are less likely to get carried themselves by good teammates, and in the cases of bad teams, the burden is instead on them to execute their combos flawlessly, which is especially hard when you are getting focused by the entire enemy team because you are the only one they are worried about.

I don't think I'm better than them at all, I just think, why would I let the game be controlled by my team mates when I could be in control. And if you looked at my profile to see that I'm bronze than you should know that A) I'm currently in the process of climbing out because B) I've won 9 out of 12 games. While that isn't too impressive on it's own, keep in mind I'm in Bronze working up and out, anything can happen to change that.

>Giving kills to your teammates is what you're supposed to do.

Not really. There are plenty of junglers that function primarily by getting themselves fed. This isn't some rare outlier in how junglers function. It's a major goal for a large number of junglers.

In fact, even for junglers who aren't based around snowballing themselves, it's still very often the best decision to take actions only devoted to making yourself stronger (for example, tanks like Sejuani and Amumu benefit heavily from ganking a lane that their teammate is already winning so that they can siphon some of the gold and experience. You'll see top-level junglers doing this all the time.

Statements like "Giving kills to your teammates is what you're supposed to do." and "understanding that you influence the game in a large way while getting none of the credit you deserve is the biggest thing" just aren't correct. They're way too restrictive. There is a large amount of extremely good jungle play that completely and utterly ignores both of these statements. Using these as rules that junglers have to follow is wrong.

I was using that as a broad statement. Yes, I know that a jungler also needs kills and gold and experience, but I don't gank lanes thinking "Let's do this for MY benefit." If I get the kill, great, got more money than I thought I would, whatever. My main goal is to help out each lane as much as possible, and the fact that I get a good deal of gold and experience from doing it is in my eyes an added benefit of doing that.

>I was using that as a broad statement.

I know, and it's incorrect. The idea that junglers work best when ganking primarily to make their lanes stronger is too restrictive. There are great strategies which are completely contrary to that.

>I don't gank lanes thinking "Let's do this for MY benefit.

You totally could though, and many of the best junglers do. Ganking lanes only with the goal of making yourself stronger is a very effective jungling tactic. You may not personally take this approach (and just to be clear, your approach is also perfectly fine), but it absolutely is not a worse way of jungling.

The tank meta had multiple non-tank jungle champs that were amazing because you had time and the extra jungle gold needed to scale.

That was because the champs were really differentiated from each other. Tanks had a weak early clear so if you cleared better than them early, you could easily outfarm them and just outdo them with numbers.

For instance, during the tank meta I believe Eve had a historically high win rate because she could gank multiple lanes while the tanks were still clearing and had %HP to nuke them late game.
Honestly it shocks me that people think tanks are mobile. I assume they are assassin players.

The jungle is actually probably the best lane right now. Don't get me wrong it's nowhere near as good as it was last season but compared to the other lanes it's fine. 

Top lane: Go even as the other lanes snowball. If your team snowballed you get carried so long as you didn't feed. If the enemy team snowballs you lose the game.

Mid: Pick Lux/Corki/AhrI (no I'm not including Zed). If you haven't picked one of those three, proceed to watch as they sit back all game with no incentive to take risks as they will outperform you in mid game teamfights 

ADC: Pick Vayne/Ezreal/Kalista. If not playing one of those three, proceed to get killed by Vayne the moment your support leaves, do no damage to Iceborn Exreal, or get kited by Kalista. 

Support: Forced to take care of 3 children because your team decided to run a triple ADC comp.
